alert.note: Alert for Riverside; San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 01 at 2:16PM PDT until September 01 at 6:45PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Riverside County in southern California... San Bernardino County in southern California... * Until 645 PM PDT. * At 216 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Blythe, Midland, Nicholls Warm Springs, Blythe Airport, Ripley, Palo Verde and East Blythe. This includes the following highways... CA Interstate 10 between mile markers 115 and 124. CA Route 95 near mile marker 1...and between mile markers 10 and 18. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
